metadata.title: Week 1 Day 2: Latin Alphabet and Classroom Vocabulary

prior_knowledge_digest: Students should have a basic understanding of the Latin alphabet and its pronunciation. They should be familiar with the concept of connecting sounds to written letters, as well as the importance of discipline in learning a new language. Additionally, they should have been introduced to some basic Latin vocabulary related to classroom objects and greetings.
yesterday_recap: Yesterday, we introduced the Latin alphabet and practiced its pronunciation. We also began learning basic vocabulary related to classroom objects.

primary: Students will recite the Latin alphabet with correct pronunciation.
Students will identify and pronounce basic Latin vocabulary related to classroom objects.
Students will understand the virtue of discipline in the context of language learning.
Students will translate the faith phrase 'In principio' and discuss its significance.
Students will demonstrate the ability to connect Latin sounds to written letters.

lesson_flow.description: Review the Latin alphabet with the class using the alphabet chart.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students recite the alphabet along with the teacher.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Focus on correct pronunciation and rhythm.

lesson_flow.description: Quick review of vocabulary from Day 1 using flashcards.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students pronounce each word as it is shown.

lesson_flow.description: Introduce new vocabulary related to classroom objects.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students listen and repeat each new word.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Use visuals to help students connect words with objects.

lesson_flow.description: Practice pronunciation and usage of new vocabulary in simple sentences.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students form sentences using the new vocabulary.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Encourage students to use vocabulary in context.

lesson_flow.description: Discuss the faith phrase 'In principio' and its significance.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students reflect on the phrase and share thoughts.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Connect the phrase to the virtue of discipline.

lesson_flow.description: Recap the day's learning and preview the next lesson.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students share one thing they learned today.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Encourage students to practice at home.
